references.citationString: Schmidt, M., Dolfus, D., Esser, O., Graf, A., Mattes, J., ICOS RI, 2021. ICOS ETC Eddy Flux Raw ASCII daily archive, Selhausen Juelich, 2021-03-07, https://hdl.handle.net/11676/yAr97S5gXS2gEr2J0E8r1QJg

comments: The station Selhausen Juelich, with ICOS code DE-RuS, is a crop site located in the catchment of the river Rur, between the cities of Duren and Juelich. The climate is maritime temperate and the field has a size of 9.7 ha, a slope of about 0.3°, and is surrounded by fields with the same type of crop rotation, occasionally including additional crops such as rapeseed, potatoes, maize oat and white mustard.
self.label: DE-RuS

documentation.name: DE-RuS ICOS Ecosystem Station Labelling Report.pdf

comments: Lands covered with temporary crops followed by harvest and a bare soil period (e.g., single and multiple cropping systems). Note that perennial woody crops will be classified as the appropriate forest or shrub land cover type.
ecosystemType.label: Croplands

format.label: Multi-file zip archive with ETC raw time series

self.label: ICOS ETC Eddy Flux Raw ASCII daily archive

comments: The station Selhausen Juelich, with ICOS code DE-RuS, is a crop site located in the catchment of the river Rur, between the cities of Duren and Juelich.
